properties.description:
ZEN Trail

Rating: Difficult

Lots of work for a big payoff. The ZEN trail is classic desert singletrack with a punchy climb leading to a fast technical descent.

Bearclaw Poppy

Rating: Intermediate

This is one of the the only true beginner trail in Saint George, but a trail that's fun for riders of every skill level. It's a smooth roller coaster and a blast for everyone.

Church Rocks

Rating: Intermediate

Church Rocks is a stand alone trail, but also part of the Prospector and Dino Cliffs trail network. It's mostly slick rock and so there are many ways to ride this trail. It's not always clearly marked, but if you take a different rout it's still fun.

Barrel Trail

Rating: Difficult

For those who enjoy some air time, this trail delivers. Features such as the 'Waterfall', rock rollers, and carefully-built jumps and tables provide challenges that some riders will want to session again and again to master.

Moe's Valley Bouldering

Rating: Various

A massive Bouldering area with over 250 routes. A perfect winter get away for climbers when Northern Utah is covered in snow.

Black Rock's Climbing Area

Rating: Various

A fun cragging area with sport routes ranging from 5.8 to 5.13. The rock is mainly basalt, which makes for interesting climbing.

Green Valley Gap Climbing Area

Rating: Various

A great beginner intro to sandstone climbing. Single pitch sport route line this small canyon system.

Quail Creek Trail

Rating: Intermediate

Hard packed sand is great for hiking during or after a rain storm. It will take you through some of the most beautiful scenery like the rest of the trails in the Red Cliffs Desert Reserve area.
